reviews.review_msg: He is a very caring professor but is uncontactable out of class, especially over email. Assignments sometimes out of nowhere, and doesn't mention them in class. He can be very disorganized with assignments and it's hard to find course materials on canvas. Mobius assignments are very very difficult and often do not relate to the midterms.

Lectures were initially synchronous, then became pre-recorded, then returned to synchronous without any formal announcements. Course itself isn't bad, but obtaining the lecture recordings, textbook materials, and lecture notes was hard because of disorganization, making the class more difficult than necessary. Khan Academy saved me in this class.

Vijay has a kind heart, however his organization could use a lot* of work. Very often the lectures would be pushed back, we would be given assignments before we learned the material, and he is very unresponsive outside of class time. No office hours. I self taught almost the whole course using the textbook (which is not mandatory). Unneeded stress.

-Vijay is confusing, dysfunctional and messy + his caring attitude can't carry the course, ur on ur own -not a lot of practice is given, *READ THE TEXTBOOK*, do exercises inside -all assignments very easy, unit tests not hard but unpredictable so tell Vijay what you're uncomfortable with (he's responsive in class but unresponsive w/ email)
Useless prof, hated by all
Unstable node
MATH 155 - buddy can't teach and scaled down the final marks :/

Math 155. Do not take any courses with him, his writing is illegible and he speaks and writes very fast. I have to pause every few seconds and rewind to reread whatever he wrote or listen again. He does not explain what he is teaching. It almost seems like he is talking to himself. Avoid.

MATH 155
He messed up one lecture about unstable spirals and I believed the wrong material for the longest time. Terrible.

He is great at explaining any question you have, makes you feel comfortable and not afraid to ask him for help. He tries to be very open and you can see all his efforts at making this tough time easier for all of us. Lots of homework, group works etc but easy to do due to the explanations and slides he constantly provides. Best prof I've had.

Best prof hands down for math130. Great attitude and genuine care towards students especially in these tough times during the pandemic. Very understanding prof and listens to what you have to say. Challenging class but office hours are very helpful.

He is a very nice and understanding prof. His assignments and group assignments were fair and he was flexible with due dates if he noticed the students were struggling. Lectures can be tough to follow, so going to office hours were very helpful. Hes really willing to help and guide students to find the answer. He wants us to succeed!

The most nicest, caring prof I've ever met. Cares about the price you pay for tuition. Will help you when you're falling behind. Gets that university is hard for students. Even if you're doing bad, he'll make sure you get something out of the effort you put in. Thanks for this semester JF!

Professor Chan was very kind and every lecture was pretty easy to follow. The course itself is a breeze because its pretty much highschool precalc. Office hours were also pretty useful for small questions and stuff. Got a B because I didn't study for the finals at all but that should speak volumes on how easy the course is lol

Justin is the best math professor I have ever had. He is accessible in tutorials, extremely kind and open to help you with your questions. He puts the students needs first and is extremely amazing at teaching and explaining math questions and concepts. HE IS THE BEST. I OWE MY PASS TO HIM!
very nice guy

Cannot stress how extremely condescending he is towards students. His teaching skills are horrid. He'll write out an entire problem across the board, check and find out what he wrote was wrong, and just move on without teaching the correct way. Laughed at students who didn't understand, and encouraged students to drop the course. Beyond horrible.

Try to avoid him, can't believe that he want to control the average grade at C (but he said it),so ridiculous, never realize this is  a 100 level course and for arts students not science. Never teach topics in clear terms, a good prof should know how to teach and motivate students , but he never do. Exams are difficult. we are not major in math !!!

Shouldn't be teaching class. No regard for students, cocky, not wary these are ARTS students forced to take the course + the majority struggle in the topic.  Attending class+all office hours he is little to no help, nor are TAs. Can't explain the topics in clear terms, and assigns hmwrk he doesn't teach. Learned everything on Khan Academy but SVG.
His accent litle bit unclear sometimes. But he's very good proffessor !!  I would like to take with him hundred of courses!!!! Best prof

really nice man. He is not the kind of skilled math teacher, but he will answer you question in patience. make few mistake in class but not a big deal, very clear class note, and very nice on your mark. Most importantly, very easy exam, almost everything you have done from notes and assignment.
He's a friendly giant and can explain pretty much anything. Thanks to him i got an A- in math 232
He is very funny, and a nice intructor. His midterms are easier than the homework assignments.
No Comments

I took MATH 130 twice with Randall Pyke a few years ago. Pyke is a very energetic and caring prof and he wants his students to do well. His main flaw is that his course content and explanations are very unclear and confusing. He communicates a lot with students and is very available, but I felt his actual content communication needed some work.

Lectures are confusing, he barely touches on what he is teaching. Instead of showing how to solve math problems, he treats lectures like he's reviewing things we already know. Lectures are skippable b/c they are useless. Tests are fair. You need to put in a lot of work and teach yourself. Praise Youtube.
To the nicest prof that teaches courses for SIAT, thank you for being an amazing teacher. I have met so many terrible profs in SFU but you are amazing!
